imr.media

Class SoundPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • imr.media.SoundPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Player

    public final class SoundPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Player
    The SoundPlayer allows playing sound files supporting the following extensions: /
    • mp3
    • mid
    • wav
    So an instance of this class can play MIDI files and several audio file formats. this class also provides support to play lists if the set method is called passing a path to a directory or a *.m3u file as parameter having files supported by this player. This class also provides methods to loop and shuffle.

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle(boolean b)
        Sets shuffle to true or false if shuffle is set to tru, files in the list are played random.
        Parameters:
        b - a boolean value, default is false. Is shuffle is set to false the files in the list are played sequentially.

      • files

        public java.lang.String[] files()
        Retrieves a list containing the files in the playing list.
        Returns:
        an array having all the file names in the playing list.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the playing list for this player. If you call the set method of the player with a path to a regular file as parameter, you must call this method before so the playing list if any is cleared and the player just have the current regular file. To avoid unexpected behaviour is better that you call this method always before calling the set method.

      • firstIndex

        public int firstIndex()
        Returns the first indexafter loading files
